intro: Tontelea corymbosa, commonly known as the Malagasy orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the humid tropical rainforests of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture in its environment. Tontelea corymbosa is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
